ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An overview of contemporary authors/artists who deal with issues of racism/inequality/politics/power/identity in their work. An in-depth reading of some of the works of these authors and a deep interaction with the problematics that the authors work with through weekly essay writing. How do these authors see the world today and how do they imagine a future through a contemporary lens? I would/have recommended the course to other students. The course is an excellent
I would definitely recommend this to another student. It is a fascinating course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I had the opportunity to engage with Afrofuturism (which was new for me) as well as an array of sci fi writers across race, gender and ethnicity. I was able to think about theories and applications for my dissertation/research.
